intro: Polygala amphothrix, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae, which includes over 700 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
